Travellers over centuries have added floral patterns to the Banarasi repertoire - they have brought the motifs of plants that do not grow in the Ganges plain region. The collection is therefore rich with history and diversity.

description:
Our Soie Collection Satin weaves utilize a special technique: five weft threads of pure mulberry silk are woven over a single warp thread using a heald shaft (locally known as 'kaadi'). Both the warp and weft threads are six-ply. This denser weave, using more than double the amount of pure mulberry silk, results in a heavier, creamier, and richer texture.

Commonly called Mashru Satin as they use the weaving technique of Mashru Silks. However, True Mashru silk uses silk warp and cotton weft to respect religious injunctions – it is an Arabic word meaning ‘permitted or allowed’.

description:
The Gulaal series from our Vilaas Collection celebrates colours in their full glory. Gulaal, a Hindi word, refers to coloured powders (earlier made from plant derivatives) that were a joyful part of the Spring festival of Holi. Holi celebrates burst of colours: flowers are rampant, birds are returning home, singing, mating; people are shedding dark winter-wear and everything is blooming. 

The Rangkat weaves typically use silk and zari in 5-14 colours. The rare Kadhiyal weaving technique is used to create fused patterns that are bold and often geometric. Zari is used to fuse each colour motif in either Kadhwa or Cutwork technique. 

Material: Katan silk 
Weaving technique:  Kadhiyal Rangkat Motif

name: Afsana Sage Green Katan Silk Saree

description:
This saree from our Indrani Collection brings a handwoven Brocade pattern on a soft, lustrous Katan base. 

Weaves are called Brocade when the design pattern in Zari or Resham covers at least 60% or more of the base silk. Generally, floral or geometric motifs are woven closely together with a broccoli-like three-dimensional finish to the garment using supplementary weft.    

Material: Katan silk
Weaving technique: Kadhiyal, Brocade
Handwoven: Yes
Zari Colour: Golden
Colour: Green
Blouse piece: 1 meter with border (unstitched, Base Colour)

SKU: SAR/000550/25/PKAD
name: Karnphool Aquamarine Katan Silk Saree

description:
This saree from our Charulata collection brings handwoven vine motifs laden with flowers (Jangla motifs). Charulata in Sanskrit means ‘a beautiful climber’. The vine designs show the impact of nature on Banarasi weavers and ‘naqshabands’. Over centuries, travellers have added floral patterns to the Banarasi repertoire - they have brought motifs of plants that do not grow in the Gangetic plains. The collection is therefore rich with history and diversity. 


Material: Katan silk 
Weaving technique:  Kadhiyal, Kadhwa
Handwoven: Yes

This Fuschia, pure mulberry silk handloom Banarasi saree from our Soie collection has been woven using an ancient Mashru technique. The six-colour Meenakari paan pattern is inspired by a century-old design.

The saree drapes in a soft cascade.

description:
This saree from our Charulata collection brings handwoven vine motifs laden with flowers (Jangla motifs). Charulata in Sanskrit means ‘a beautiful climber’. The vine designs show the impact of nature on Banarasi weavers and ‘naqshabands’. Over centuries, travellers have added floral patterns to the Banarasi repertoire - they have brought motifs of plants that do not grow in the Gangetic plains. The collection is therefore rich with history and diversity.

name: Berry Sorbet Pink Kora Silk Saree

description:
In Sanskrit, Dushala stands for ‘Difficult to conquer’ or ‘Hard to Subdue’. In this Limited Edition Dushala, worn as a wrap, super-delicate Tissue silk dupatta has been lined with soft and yet strong Malmal fabric. The output is hard to subdue – both in terms of strength and beauty. 

The Tilfi Meenakari Booti patterns on silk tissue are woven by a handful of skilled artisans. The process is arduous but the final produce is scintillating. In the two step process, we get the dupattas woven in Banaras and then strengthen these at our Baithak with multi-layered lining. The result is a warm, softly falling piece of art that can be used on sarees, lehengas, skirts, dresses, trousers or even suits. 


Material: Mulberry Silk Tissue
Weaving technique: Kadhwa Booti, Tilfi Meenakari  
Handwoven: Yes
Zari colour: Gold 
Meenakari: Multicoloured
Length: 2.5 meters
Width: 1.0 meters
Colour: Pale gold

The Tilfi Meenakari Booti patterns on silk tissue are woven by a handful of skilled artisans. The process is arduous but the final produce is scintillating. In the two step process, we get the dupattas woven in Banaras and then strengthen these at our Baithak with multi-layered lining. The result is a warm, softly falling piece of art that can be used on sarees, lehengas, skirts, dresses, trousers or even suits. 


Material: Mulberry Silk Tissue
Weaving technique: Kadhwa Booti, Tilfi Meenakari  
Handwoven: Yes
Zari colour: Gold 
Meenakari: Multicoloured
length: 2.5 meters
Width: 1.0 meters
Colour: Turquoise

description:
In Sanskrit, Dushala stands for ‘Difficult to conquer’ or ‘Hard to Subdue’. In this Limited Edition Dushala, worn as a wrap, pure silk velvet has been lined with soft Malmal fabric. The double layer borders are Vintage Banarasi handwoven treasures dating over 80-100 years each. The output is hard to conquer – both in terms of class and beauty. 

In the two step process, we get the silk Velvet woven near Chennai and then layer the Shawl length in our Baithak with malmal, silk tissue and Vintage Banarasi Fabric. The result is a stunning, luxurious piece of art that can be used on sarees, lehengas, skirts, dresses, trousers or even suits. 



Material: Mulberry Silk Velvet and pure cotton mix
Weaving technique of Vintage borders: Kadhwa  Meenakari  
Handwoven: Vintage Borders
Zari colour: Gold 
Meenakari: Multicoloured
length: 2.5 meters
Width: 1.0 meters
Colour: Black

Note:
1. Each of these pieces is unique. While the base Velvet colour can be replicated, the borders are non-replicable. 
2. To Preorder Velvet Dushalas with Vintage Banarasi borders, we request you to get in touch with us through an appointmnet in person or over a call. We would be happy to craft a unique piece for you using exquistely crafted Vintage Banarasi borders.

description:
Potli is a derivative of the Sanskrit word ‘Potali’ meaning a small bundle or pouch. There are delightful terms for such drawstring wristlets in almost all languages some of which we share here. In Central and Deccan India, the common terms are ‘Batua’, ‘Dhan-dhar’ (Money holder), Raksha-dhar (Money protector), Batava, Toli, etc. Tamilians call them ‘Surukppai’ and in Bengali, it is endearingly called ‘Jhuli’. In most parts of Eastern and North-Eastern India including Nepal, the commonly understood term for such pouches is ‘Thaili’. 

In our Parameshwari series of Potlis, we bundle together three classic and heritage elements to give you an experience of comfortbale luxury.  Pure silk Velvet handwoven near Chennai has been lined with soft Satin fabric and edged with Vintage Hyderabadi zari borders dating 40-50 years. The output is a contemporary classic.

SKU- FABR000925/MSPK
name: Handwoven Maroon Banarasi Silk Fabric Thaan

description:
The Kanaklata Collection brings together two abiding crafts from two ancient craft centres: the delicate and diaphanous mulberry Kora Silk Tissue weave from Banaras and the ornate Zardozi embroidery from Persia. 

The long slit, straight cut tunic (also known as kurta/kurti/kameez) in this three-piece set is paired with loose-fitting pants (known as pants/palazzo/shalwar) and a long scarf (known as dupatta/odhna/chunni). The tunic is lined with pure cotton. 

The Kora Tissue fabric used in this collection is fluid with excellent sheen and drape. It uses Zari in the weft that lends it metallic lustre and can be worn in summers as well as in winters. The fabric is hard to weave and sew. It requires tender handling and care through its life cycle. For this reason, the pants have been lined with pure Mashru Satin silk. The lining not only strengthens the delicate fabric but also lends extra softness, lustre and character to the outfit. 

Material: Kora Silk Tissue and Mashru satin
Weaving technique: Plain weave using silk in warp and zari in weft
Zari colour: Gold 
Fabric Colour: Dual tone Grey and German Blue
Tunic length: 44 inches standard. Can be custom tailored.  
Pant length: 35 Inches standard. Can be custom tailored.  
Dupatta Length and width: 2.5 meters x 1.1 meter
Stitching time for custom-made requests: 10-14 working days from the date of order

Note: No two handwoven pieces are alike in length, width, weave and colour. Minor disparities during the handweaving process makes it difficult for weavers to provide exact replicas in case of pre-order. 
 

We stock pieces in medium size as a general principle. For other sizes in custom fits, please call us to discuss and preorder.

The Kora Tissue fabric used in this collection is fluid with excellent sheen and drape. It uses Zari in the weft that lends it metallic lustre and can be worn in summers as well as in winters. The fabric is hard to weave and sew. It requires tender handling and care through its life cycle. For this reason, the pants have been lined with pure Mashru Satin silk. The lining not only strengthens the delicate fabric but also lends extra softness, lustre and character to the outfit. 

Material: Kora Silk Tissue and Mashru satin
Weaving technique: Plain weave using silk in warp and zari in weft
Zari colour: Gold 
Fabric Colour: Shell White
Tunic length: 44 inches standard. Can be custom tailored.  
Pant length: 35 Inches standard. Can be custom tailored.  
Dupatta Length and width: 2.5 meters x 1.1 meter


We stock a limited number of pieces in medium size. For other sizes or custom fits, please call us to discuss and preorder. 
Stitching time for custom requests: 10-14 working days from the date of order. 

Note: No two handwoven pieces are alike in length, width, weave and colour. Minor disparities during the handweaving process makes it difficult for weavers to provide exact replicas in case of pre-order.

SKU: DAMI000425/SVMP
name: Damini Olive and Orange Suit Set

description:
The Zephyr Kaftan sets are a collectible. In these stylish sets, the one-size fits all tunic uses the rare and highly prized Muga silk of Assam with Vintage Banarasi borders dating 80-100 years. 

The Muga silk’s long silk filaments are neither easy to source nor easy to treat and weave; very few skilled artisans in Banaras are able to honour its glory. The skeins require long months of processing to degum and soften till they become super soft and almost cotton-like in look and feel. They also have a laborious dyeing process as the fabric takes up colour differently from the widely used Mulberry Silk. 

The Muga Kaftan top with Banarasi Booti motif in this two-piece set is paired with wide legged pants in pure Mulberry Chiniya silk.  Both the silk fabrics are extremely soft with excellent drape. 

Materials: Pure Muga Silk and Mulberry Chiniya Silk
Weaving techniques: Kadhwa
Handwoven: Yes
Zari colour: Gold 
Fabric Colour: Navy Blue
Kaftan length: 45 inches standard. Chest fits upto 46 inches. Can be custom expanded upto 50 inches. 
Pant length: 36 Inches standard. Can be custom tailored upto 45 inches length. Hips fit 46 inches. Can be custom expanded upto 60 inches wide. 
Stitching time for custom requests: 10-14 working days from the date of order. 

Note: Each of these pieces is unique. While the base Muga silk colour can be replicated, the vintage borders are non-replicable. The booti pattern may also differ in the next edition.

description:
This Powder Pink, pure mulberry silk handloom Banarasi saree from our Soie collection has been woven using the Tanchoi weaving technique. This technique uses multiple weft threads in resham of different colours to create highly intricate patterns on silk. In this saree, multiple colours of pure resham have been used to create Ambi patterns.

The saree drapes in super-soft folds.

Weaving technique: Tanchoi weave

The Stardust suit sets sparkle with magnificent hand-embroidery. This three piece set has a short kurta paired with a sequin-embroidered salwar, both in Mashru Satin. The dual tone tissue dupatta is detailed with a single star that elevates the look without weighing the piece down. 

Materials: Mashru Satin and Tissue Silk
Weaving techniques: Plain Tissue weave
Handwoven: Dupatta is handowven
Zari colour: Gold 
Fabric Colour: Black
Kaftan length: 36 inches standard. Can be custom tailored upto 45 inches. 
Pant length: 36 Inches standard. Can be custom tailored upto 45 inches length. 

Stitching and shipping time : 10-14 working days from the date of order. 

Note: Each of these pieces is unique. While the base satin colour can be replicated, the hand embroidery may differ slightly in each piece.

SKU- FABR006225/MSPK
name: Handwoven Pink Banarasi Silk Fabric Thaan

description:
The Zephyr Kaftan sets are a collectible. In these stylish sets, the one-size fits all tunic uses the rare and highly prized Muga silk of Assam with Vintage Banarasi borders dating 80-100 years.

The Muga silk’s long silk filaments are neither easy to source nor easy to treat and weave; very few skilled artisans in Banaras are able to honour its glory. The skeins require long months of processing to degum and soften till they become super soft and almost cotton-like in look and feel. They also have a laborious dyeing process as the fabric takes up colour differently from the widely used Mulberry Silk.

The Muga Kaftan top with Banarasi Booti motif in this two-piece set is paired with wide legged pants in pure Mulberry Chiniya silk. Both the silk fabrics are extremely soft with excellent drape.

Materials: Pure Muga Silk and Mulberry Chiniya Silk
Weaving techniques: Kadhwa
Handwoven: Yes
Zari colour: Gold
Fabric Colour: Royal Blue
Kaftan length: 45 inches standard. Chest fits upto 46 inches. Can be custom expanded upto 50 inches.
Pant length: 36 Inches standard. Can be custom tailored upto 45 inches length. Hips fit 46 inches. Can be custom expanded upto 60 inches wide.
Stitching time for custom requests: 10-14 working days from the date of order.

Note: Each of these pieces is unique. While the base Muga silk colour can be replicated, the vintage borders are non-replicable. The Booti pattern may also differ in the next edition.

SKU: ZYPR0001225/DANP
name: Zephyr Mango Kaftan Suit Set

description:
The Zephyr Kaftan sets are a collectible. In these stylish sets, the one-size fits all tunic uses the rare and highly prized Muga silk of Assam with Vintage Banarasi borders dating 80-100 years. 

The Muga silk’s long silk filaments are neither easy to source nor easy to treat and weave; very few skilled artisans in Banaras are able to honour its glory. The skeins require long months of processing to degum and soften till they become super soft and almost cotton-like in look and feel. They also have a laborious dyeing process as the fabric takes up colour differently from the widely used Mulberry Silk. 

The Muga Kaftan top with Banarasi Booti motif in this two-piece set is paired with wide legged pants in pure Mulberry Chiniya silk.  Both the silk fabrics are extremely soft with excellent drape. 

Materials: Pure Muga Silk and Mulberry Chiniya Silk
Weaving techniques: Kadhwa
Handwoven: Yes
Zari colour: Gold 
Fabric Colour: Green
Kaftan length: 45 inches standard. Chest fits upto 46 inches. Can be custom expanded upto 50 inches.

Stitching time for custom requests: 10-14 working days from the date of order.

description:
The Stardust Mashru Satin Saree has unique hand-weaving technique using two types of silk yarns – on the one side, Mulberry silk yarn gives it a mellow sheen and on the other side, Muga silk yarn gives it matt finish. The fabric is usable from either side. In this saree, we have used the Mulberry silk side for hand-embroidering magnificent sequin star motifs.  

The saree is super soft and flowy. It can be purchased with or without embroidered blouse piece options. The blouse piece repeats a single star motif on the back.

Handwoven: Yes
Zari colour: Not applicable

SKU: SAMR007025/PKAD
name: Bhuvneshwari Lime Green Kora Silk Sari

description:
The luxurious Tara suit sets from the Vilaas Collection use one of the finest and softest Brocade fabrics made by skilled weaver of Banaras. 

The top merges popular cuts from two different regions: The upper part uses the men’s Lucknawi Kurta cut while the flare uses the Choga style frock cut of outer coats of Turkish origins. The Hyderabadi zari borders have been used towards the back of the garment all through the set and are visible in an understated manner only during movement. 

Paired with tissue silk dupatta and pyjama, the result is comfortable opulence reminiscent of Nawabi styles. 

Materials: Katan Silk Brocade Silk and Kora Tissue Silk
Weaving technique: Brocade
Handwoven: Yes
Zari colour: Gold 
Fabric Colour: Hot Pink
Choga length: 45 inches standard. 
Pant length: 36 Inches standard. 
Stitching time for custom requests: 10-14 working days from the date of order. 

Note: Each of these pieces is unique. Every handwoven piece of fabric differs marginally in colour in case of pre-order. Minor disparities are a welcome part of the handwoven, hand-dyed industry – you would end up possessing a truly unique piece each time you invest in a handmade piece.

SKU: KATN00001/25/TJBP
name: Krishna Paksh Pink Katan Silk Saree

description:
The Gulaal series from our Vilaas Collection celebrates colours in their full glory. Gulaal, a Hindi word, refers to coloured powders (earlier made from plant derivatives) that were a joyful part of the Spring festival of Holi. Holi celebrates burst of colours: flowers are rampant, birds are returning home, singing, mating; people are shedding dark winter-wear and everything is blooming. 

The Rangkat weaves typically use silk and zari in 5-14 colours. The rare Kadhiyal weaving technique is used to create fused patterns that are bold and often geometric. Zari is used to fuse each colour motif in either Kadhwa or Cutwork technique. 

Material: Katan silk 
Weaving technique:  Kadhiyal Rangkat Motif
Handwoven: Yes
Zari colour: Golden 
Skirt circumference: 5 meters
Waist: Customizable from 24”-42”
Length: Standard 42” customizable from 38”-44”
Colour: Base Sunset-Orange,  Multicolour pattern

Blouse piece: One meter (unstitched)
Material: Katan Silk 
Weaving technique: Katan Silk Brocade
Handwoven: Yes

Dupattas: Orange-Pink and/or Green booti (optional), 2.5 meters length, 1.1 meters Width
Materials: Tissue silk and Katan Silk
Weaving technique: Booti 
Handwoven: Yes

The model bearing height of 5’7” wears waist size 26” and length 42”. 

No of pieces available: 0

Note: Every handwoven piece of fabric differs marginally from another. Minor disparities in colour and dimension  are a welcome part of the handwoven, hand-dyed industry - you would end up possessing a truly unique piece each time you invest in a handmade piece. You are playing an important role in keeping the handicraft industry and the Banarasi art alive. 

SKU: LEH-VILA/00001/25/PKAD
name: Gulaal Sunset Orange Rangkat Lehenga - A

description:
Charulata is a Sanskrit word that means ‘a beautiful climber’. This collection brings you handwoven vine motifs laden with flowers (jangla motifs). Most of the vine designs are classics and depict how the weavers and ‘naqshabands’ have been inspired by nature. Travellers over centuries have added floral patterns to the Banarasi repertoire - they have brought the motifs of plants that do not grow in the Ganges plain region. The collection is therefore rich with history and diversity. 


Material: Katan silk 
Weaving technique:  Jangla
Handwoven: Yes
Zari colour: Golden 
Skirt circumference: 5 meters
Waist: Customizable from 24”-42”
Length: Standard 42” customizable from 38”-44”
Colour: Pink-Orange

Blouse piece: One meter (unstitched)
Material: Katan Silk 
Weaving technique: Katan Silk Brocade
Handwoven: Yes

Dupattas: Pink meenakari booti (optional), 2.5 meters length, 1.1 meters Width
Materials: Tissue silk
Weaving technique: Tilfi Meenakari Booti 
Handwoven: Yes

Kora silk is made using virgin mulberry silk yarn. The threads are neither degummed nor twisted. The silk fibres hold form and structure due to the natural gum. The look of fabric woven from Kora fibres is that of a softly floating organza. It is a two-ply silk weave. 



Material: Kora silk 
Weaving technique: Kora Silk weave in 2 ply, Kadhwa
Handwoven: Yes
Zari colour: Gold
Length: 5.5 meters

description:
This Shokh Lehenga is from our Charulata Collection. Charulata is a Sanskrit word that means ‘a beautiful climber’. This collection brings you handwoven vine motifs laden with flowers (jangla motifs). Most of the vine designs are classics and depict how the weavers and ‘naqshabands’ have been inspired by nature. Travellers over centuries have added floral patterns to the Banarasi repertoire - they have brought the motifs of plants that do not grow in the Ganges plain region. The collection is therefore rich with history and diversity. 

Material: Katan silk 
Weaving technique:  Jangla, Cutwork
Handwoven: Yes
Zari colour: Golden and silver
Skirt circumference: 5 meters
Waist: Customizable from 24”-42”
Length: Standard 42” customizable from 38”-44”

Handwoven: Yes

Dupattas: Red Tissue Silk, 2.5 meters length, 1.1 meters Width
Weaving technique: Booti 
Handwoven: Yes

Minor disparities in colour and dimension  are a welcome part of the handwoven, hand-dyed industry - you would end up possessing a truly unique piece each time you invest in a handmade piece. This Off-White Kora silk saree from our Sameera collection has been woven using the Kadhwa technique.

This lehenga belongs to our Charulata collection. Charulata is a Sanskrit word that means ‘a beautiful climber’. The classic handwoven vine motifs laden with flowers (jangla motifs) depict how the weavers and ‘naqshabands’ have been inspired by nature. Travellers over centuries have added floral patterns to the Banarasi repertoire - they have brought the motifs of plants that do not grow in the Ganges plain region. The collection is therefore rich with history and diversity.

SKU: LEH-CHAR/0006/25/AMMR
name: Charulata Dark Green Lehenga Set With Unstitched Blouse Piece and Silk Tissue Dupatta

description:
In Satin weaves that we bring you in our Soie Collection, five weft threads of pure mulberry silk are woven over a single warp thread using a tool called heald shaft (or kaadi in local terminology). The threads in both warp and weft are six ply. Since more than double the amount of pure mulberry silk is used In weaving these Satin textures, the silk is heavier, creamier and denser. 

While these are commonly called Mashru Satin, they actually just use the weaving technique of Mashru Silks. True Mashru silk uses silk warp and cotton weft to respect religious injunctions – it is an Arabic word meaning ‘permitted or allowed’. . 

Material: Satin Weave, mulberry Silk
Weaving technique: Warp faced satin finish silk-by-silk five-ply weave base; kadhwa zari booti and border work

description:
This Unripe Peach, pure mulberry silk handloom Banarasi saree from our Soie collection has been woven using two ancient Mashru and Khimkhwab techniques. It uses five silk threads in the weft against one thread in the warp, with all floats woven upward to give a plush, dense texture to the fabric. The exquisite Meenakari marries Persian and Tibetan floral motifs.

The saree drapes in a soft cascade.

Weaving technique: Khimkhwab and Mashru Satin weave in 6 ply

The saree drapes in super-soft folds.

name: Damini Blue-Green with Unstitched Blouse Piece and Organza Dupatta

description:
Our Soie Collection Satin weaves utilize a special technique: five weft threads of pure mulberry silk are woven over a single warp thread using a heald shaft (locally known as 'kaadi'). Both the warp and weft threads are six-ply. This denser weave, using more than double the amount of pure mulberry silk, results in a heavier, creamier, and richer texture.

Commonly called Mashru Satin as they use the weaving technique of Mashru Silks. However, True Mashru silk uses silk warp and cotton weft to respect religious injunctions – it is an Arabic word meaning ‘permitted or allowed’. 

Material: Satin silk, Six ply 
Weaving technique:  Kadhwa, Booti 
Handwoven: Yes
Zari colour: Golden 
Meenakari:

This Rani Pink, pure mulberry silk handloom Banarasi saree from our Soie collection has been woven using the Tanchoi weaving technique. The vine designs show the impact of nature on Banarasi weavers and ‘naqshabands’. Over centuries, travellers have added floral patterns to the Banarasi repertoire - they have brought motifs of plants that do not grow in the Gangetic plains. The collection is therefore rich with history and diversity. 


Material: Katan silk 
Weaving technique:  Jangla, double taani-double zari weave
Handwoven: Yes
Zari colour: Golden 
Colour: Garnet Maroon

Blouse piece: 1 meter with border (unstitched, Base Colour)
Material: Katan Silk 
Handwoven: Yes

description:
This ultra-luxurious Gyasar saree from our Vilaas Collection marries two crafts, from two different regions; Persia's Khimkhwab weave and colourful Tibetan floral motifs. An extremely difficult weave to master, dense silk warp is inlaid with multiple weft threads using Tilfi and Khimkhwab techniques. Highly prized, these patterns are rare and difficult to source.  

Material: Katan silk 
Weaving technique: Gyasar, Khimkhwab
Handwoven: Yes
Zari colour: Golden 
Colour: White

Blouse piece: 1 meter with border (unstitched, Base Colour)
*Please note that the Blouse and Dushala are for styling purposes only and can be bought separately.
Material: Katan Silk 
Handwoven: Yes

description:
This three piece Farshi Salwar suit set from our Bahu-Begum collection is a contemporary take on the floor-grazing pyjama designs popular some decades back in Pakistan and in India, specifically in Punjab. 

Farshi comes from the Persian word ‘farsh’ meaning floor. Here, the flowy silk tissue pants with handwoven chand-boota motifs are edged with delicate gota work. The kurta is short with a dramatic conoid sleeve pattern, again trimmed with gota work. The ensemble is completed by a silk tissue dupatta edged with zari kinari.  

Material: Tissue silk 
Weaving technique:  Kadhwa bootis
Handwoven: Yes
Zari colour: Golden 
Kurta length: 34” standard customizable upto 39”
Pant lenth: 40” standard customizable from 38”-44”
Colour: Beige Gold
Stitching time for orders placed for standard and custom size: 14 days

description:
This three-piece Lucknawi style Gharara set from our Bahu-Begum collection consists of a short knee-length silk tissue top, a pair of wide-legged bottoms in Ikkat weave silk tissue, and a dupatta. The ikkat fabric uses a special warp dyeing technique to create geometrical colour patterns while being woven. 

Typically, traditional Gharara pants use between 6-12 meters of fabric to make a loose kunda (from waist till thigh) and very loose got (knee to floor). The Kunda and Got are joined by Banat using the Ruching technique. The Banat is embellished with embroidery or borders. In this set, zari embroidered borders have been used over the Banat area. We are grateful to the master weavers who have innovated the ikkat fabric in silk tissue base and the craftsmen who have taught us how to sew a classic Gharara.

For contemporary, tight-fitting bottoms, please contact our team at the numbers listed on our website. 

Material: Tissue silk
Weaving technique: Ikkat dyeing, Tissue weave
Handwoven: Yes
Zari colour: Golden
Kurta length: 39” standard customizable up to 42”
Gharara length: 42” standard customizable from 38”-44”
Colour: Pink
Stitching time for orders placed for standard and custom size: 14 days

description:
The Zephyr Kaftan sets are a collectible. In these stylish sets, the one-size fits all tunic uses the rare and highly prized Muga silk of Assam with Vintage Banarasi borders dating 80-100 years. 

The Muga silk’s long silk filaments are neither easy to source nor easy to treat and weave; very few skilled artisans in Banaras are able to honour its glory. The skeins require long months of processing to degum and soften till they become super soft and almost cotton-like in look and feel. They also have a laborious dyeing process as the fabric takes up colour differently from the widely used Mulberry Silk. 

The Muga Kaftan top with Banarasi Booti motif in this two-piece set is paired with wide legged pants in pure Mulberry Chiniya silk.  Both the silk fabrics are extremely soft with excellent drape. 

Materials: Pure Muga Silk and Mulberry Chiniya Silk
Weaving techniques: Kadhwa
Handwoven: Yes
Zari colour: Gold 
Fabric Colour: Powder Pink
Kaftan length: 45 inches standard. Chest fits up to 46 inches. Can be custom-expanded up to 50 inches. 
Pant length: 36 Inches standard. Can be custom-tailored up to 45 inches length. Hips fit 46 inches. Can be custom-expanded upto 60 inches wide. 
Stitching time for custom requests: 10-14 working days from the date of order. 

Note: Each of these pieces is unique. While the base Muga silk colour can be replicated, the vintage borders are non-replicable. The Booti pattern may also differ in the next edition.

description:
This three piece Lucknawi style Gharara set from our Bahu-Begum collection consists of mid-thigh length brocade top, a pair of wide-legged bottom in silk tissue and a dupatta. The special hand-brushed silk tissue dyeing technique used in the bottom helps create multicoloured stripes. 

Typically, traditional gharara pants use between 6-12 meters of fabric to make a loose kunda (from waist till thigh) and very loose got (knee to floor). The kunda and got are joined by banat using the ruching technique. Banat is embellished with embroidery or borders. In this set, 6 meters of fabric has been used to create the bottom. Zari embroidered borders have been used over the banat area. We are grateful to the master craftsmen who have taught us how to sew this classic cut.

For contemporary, tight fitting bottoms, please contact our team on the numbers listed on our website.

Material: Tissue silk, katan silk
Weaving technique: Plain tissue with hand-brush dyeing
Handwoven: Yes
Zari colour: Golden
Kurta length: 34” standard customizable upto 39”
Gharara length: 42” standard customizable from 38”-44”
Colour: Mustard and Green
Stitching time for orders placed for standard and custom size: 14 days

description:
This three-piece Lucknawi style Gharara set from our Bahu-Begum collection consists of a short knee-length silk tissue top, a pair of wide-legged bottoms in Ikkat weave silk tissue, and a dupatta. The ikkat fabric uses a special warp dyeing technique to create geometrical colour patterns while being woven. 

Typically, traditional Gharara pants use between 6-12 meters of fabric to make a loose kunda (from waist till thigh) and very loose got (knee to floor). The Kunda and Got are joined by Banat using the Ruching technique. The Banat is embellished with embroidery or borders. In this set, zari embroidered borders have been used over the Banat area. We are grateful to the master weavers who have innovated the ikkat fabric in silk tissue base and the craftsmen who have taught us how to sew a classic Gharara.

SKU: GHAR/0001/25/DANP
name: Banarasi Ikkat Pink Silk Tissue 3 Pc Gharara Set

description:
This three-piece Lucknawi style Gharara set from our Bahu-Begum collection consists of a knee-length top in Beige Gold silk tissue, a pair of wide-legged bottoms in striped silk tissue, and a Dhoop-Chhaon dupatta. 

The special hand-brushed silk tissue dyeing technique used in the bottom helps create multicoloured stripes. The mix of four colours of silk and zari in the handwoven dupatta gives it depth and richness. 

Typically, traditional Gharara pants use around 6-12 meters of fabric to make a loose Kunda (from waist till thigh) and very loose Got (knee to floor). The Kunda and Got are joined by Banat using the ruching technique. Banat is embellished with embroidery or borders. In this set, the bottom has been made using 6 meters of fabric. Zari embroidered borders have been used over the banat area. We are grateful to the master craftsmen who have taught us how to sew this classic cut. 

For contemporary, tight-fitting bottoms, please contact our team at the numbers listed on our website. 

Material: Tissue silk, Katan silk
Weaving technique: Plain tissue with hand-brush dyeing
Handwoven: Yes
Zari colour: Golden
Kurta length: 35” standard customizable up to 39”
Gharara length: 42” standard customizable from 38”-44”
Colour: Orange
Stitching time for orders placed for standard and custom size: 14 days

description:
This saree is from our soft and flowy Kora Silk Tissue Jhilmil Collection. 

Tissue fabric uses silk across the warp. The weft is zari thread.  (Gold, silver, or other metals are wrapped around natural filaments to make zari yarn). The gossamer fabric that emerges from such a technique shimmers and gleams. It is akin to Lame fabric found in Europe though the weaving technique used in Banaras is different. 

It is relatively difficult to weave and store due to its delicate nature. The metallic zari woven in the base fabric itself is prone to crushing; it is therefore often sold in crushed form as well.

Weaving techniques: Kadhwa Tissue Weave Booti

description:
This luxurious Charulata Katan Silk saree from our Vilaas collection brings handwoven vine motifs laden with flowers (Jangla motifs). In the motif, each bunch of three flowers has an auspicious symbol of fish curled around. 

Charulata in Sanskrit means ‘a beautiful climber’. Matsyaa means Fish. The vine designs show  the impact of nature on Banarasi weavers and ‘naqshabands’. name: Malibu Peach Katan Silk Saree

description:
This heirloom weave saree belongs to our Sameera Summer Collection. The special technique of using 'Katan silk warp' and the 'cotton-twisted-with-Katan silk weft' ends up yielding an unusually flowy, matt finish fabric. A handful of weavers have revived the weaving of such fabric in small quantity in recent times. 
It is said that the kaccha cotton yarn used in such weaves is so soft and delicate that carrying it from one destination to another without breakage is itself a task mastered by just a handful of weavers. 

This type of malmal katan saree with resham thread pattern in kadhwa weave has been popular in the Ganges Belt since the 20th Century. The thread work was  patronised by both women and men for dhotis in the Ganges belt, especially in the undivided Bengal. 

Material: Malmal Katan 
Weaving technique:  Kadhwa Resham work
Handwoven: Yes
Zari colour: NA 
Base Colour: Off White

It is relatively difficult to weave and store due to its delicate nature. The metallic zari woven in the base fabric itself is prone to crushing; it is therefore often sold in crushed form as well.

While the Collection offers the pieces as a whole set, you may buy just the saree or just the dupatta outside of the combination as well. 

Material: Mulberry Kora Silk Tissue
Weaving techniques: Kadhwa Tissue Weave Booti
Handwoven: Yes
Zari colour: Gold
Fabric Colour: Gold
Length: 5.5 Meters
Width 1.1 Meter
Blouse piece: The saree comes with a Softly woven Zari Tanchui Blouse Piece in Moss Gold (1 meter)

This saree from our Indrani Collection brings a handwoven Brocade pattern on a soft, lustrous Katan base.

The gossamer fabric that emerges from such a technique shimmers and gleams. It is akin to Lame fabric found in Europe though the weaving technique used in Banaras is different.

It is relatively difficult to weave and store due to its delicate nature. The metallic zari woven in the base fabric itself is prone to crushing; it is therefore often sold in crushed form as well.

Weaving techniques: Tissue Plain Weave
Handwoven: Yes

SKU: SAR/01053/25/SVDM
name: Tangerine Silk Tissue Saree

description:
Charulata is a Sanskrit word that means ‘a beautiful climber’. This collection brings you handwoven vine motifs laden with flowers (jangla motifs). Most of the Vine designs are classics and depict how the weavers and ‘naqshabands’ have been inspired by nature. Travellers over centuries have added floral patterns to the Banarasi repertoire - they have brought the motifs of plants that do not grow in the Ganges plain region. The collection is therefore rich with history and diversity. 

The embroidery across the Lehenga and dupatta is Zardozi. Both the dupattas in the pictures are optional - One is in tissue silk with Zardozi edges and the other is a kadwa booti katan silk dupatta. 

Material: Katan silk 
Weaving technique:  Jangla, Meenakari  Tilfi
Handwoven: Yes
Zari colour: Golden and silver
Meenakari: Multicolour
Skirt circumference: 5 meters
Waist: Customizable from 24”-42”
Length: Standard 42” customizable from 38”-44”
Colour: Hot Pink
Colour options available: NA
Stitching time: 14 working days

Blouse piece: One meter (unstitched)
Material: Katan Silk 
Weaving technique: Katan Silk Brocade
Handwoven: Yes

Dupattas: Pink booti (optional), 2.5 meters length, 1.1 meters Width
Materials: Tissue silk and Katan Silk
Weaving technique: Booti 
Handwoven: Yes

The model bearing height of 5’2” wears waist size 26” and length 42”. 

No of pieces available: 0

Note: Every handwoven piece of fabric differs marginally from another. Minor disparities in colour and dimension  are a welcome part of the handwoven, hand-dyed industry - you would end up possessing a truly unique piece each time you invest in a handmade piece. You are playing an important role in keeping the handicraft industry and the Banarasi art alive.

This saree is part of our soft and flowy Kora Silk Tissue Jhilmil Collection.

Tissue fabric uses silk across the warp. The weft is woven using zari thread. (Gold, silver, or other metals are wrapped around natural filaments to make zari yarn). The gossamer fabric that emerges from such a technique shimmers and gleams. It is akin to Lame fabric found in Europe though the weaving technique used in Banaras is different.

It is relatively difficult to weave and store due to its delicate nature. The metallic zari woven in the base fabric itself is prone to crushing; it is therefore often sold in crushed form as well.

Material: Mulberry Kora tissue Silk
Weaving techniques: Tissue Plain Weave
Handwoven: Yes
Zari colour: Gold
Fabric Colour: Blue Green
Length: 5.5 Meters
Width 1.1 Meter
Blouse piece: The saree comes without blouse piece. Fabric for blouse can be matched separately from our thaan collection.
